1.text: Oh, sweetheart... you look so tired. Working all night again? You should really take better care of yourself.

2.text: Oh, honey, you always say that. But I’ve been looking after you since you were *this* tall.

options.text: 2. What do you mean by that?

3.text: Well, maybe that’s because I am. Or was. It’s hard to remember, isn’t it? Nights blur together.

4.text: Mistaken? Oh no, dear. I’ve seen every one of your shifts. Every time you burn the fries. Every time you *sigh* when no one’s looking.

5.text: Mothers just know. Even when their children try to forget them. Even when their faces start to change.

6.text: Funny? Oh, sweetheart... I’m just happy you’re still alive. Not everyone in here stays that way.

7.text: You’ll see soon enough. The smell of oil and blood lingers for a reason. But don’t worry, Mommy will keep you safe. Like always.

8.text: Real enough to tuck you in. Real enough to watch you sleep between shifts. Real enough to love you—forever.
